data.title: Add command to post a message to an html preview document
[FEATURE REQUEST] Go full screen with focused tab in editor window.
data.body:
```
Version 1.8.1
Commit ee428b0eead68bf0fb99ab5fdc4439be227b6281
Date 2016-12-19T14:41:20.664Z
Shell 1.4.6
Renderer 53.0.2785.143
Node 6.5.0
```

I checked the keyboard shortcuts but couldn't find this functionality. And also couldn't find it when going through the menus.
https://code.visualstudio.com/shortcuts/keyboard-shortcuts-linux.pdf

When I have 2+ editor windows opened side-by-side, I would want to go full screen with the editor tab that is focused, and back. For example by pressing Ctrl+F11.

Example of starting point as in screenshot. I want to go full screen with the focused editor tab (name in title bar) in the middle editor window. Full screen as in : just take up the place of the other 2 editor windows. Not Zen mode.

Could you please add this?

![vscode-is-it-possible-to-go-fullscreen-with-one-tab_cropped](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/22870070/21868160/ce86043a-d851-11e6-9293-db3e6126dc3d.png)

data.title: Cannot hide files on some conditions
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: Windows 7 Pro 64bits


Hi. I'm facing an issue. I'm not able to hide files on specific conditions. I'm trying do to the same thing as described here: [Hiding Derived JavaScript Files](https://code.visualstudio.com/Docs/languages/typescript#_hiding-derived-javascript-files).

In my example, I've done a simple hello world example. I'm trying to hide the derived javascript file "HelloWorld.js", generated from "HelloWorld.ts" but for a reason I don't understand, it's not working. The "When" condition doesn't seem to work. But when I put "true" instead of "$(basename).ts", my only javascript file (and other I guess if there were more than one) is hidded.

Can you tell me please what I am missing in the procedure or if it's an issue ?

Thank you for your answer.


![vscode issue](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/15614466/21867452/3339bf38-d81c-11e6-9c55-c7eb6abf8a1f.png)

data.title: Syncing with github in the app doesn't work behind a corporate proxy
data.body:
I have the proxy settings saved in my global .gitconfig and they seem to work fine with the github for windows app. I'm not really sure what needs to happen to make it work in code but I'd like it to be able to do the couple of basic things I do regularly without having to switch apps all the time.

- VSCode Version: Code 1.8.1 (ee428b0eead68bf0fb99ab5fdc4439be227b6281, 2016-12-19T14:49:23.350Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.2.2|
|python|donjayamanne|0.5.5|
|xml|DotJoshJohnson|1.7.0|
|vscode-babel-coloring|dzannotti|0.0.4|
|EditorConfig|EditorConfig|0.3.4|
|beautify|HookyQR|0.7.3|
|docomment|k--kato|0.0.11|
|theme-karyfoundation-themes|karyfoundation|10.2.0|
|mssql|ms-mssql|0.2.0|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.6.2|
|PowerShell|ms-vscode|0.8.0|
|vscode-docker|PeterJausovec|0.0.11|
|language-stylus|sysoev|1.6.0|
|ayu|teabyii|0.2.1|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open local copy of a repository on a machine behind a corporate proxy
2. Attempt to pull or use the sync feature

In the Git output pane, you'll see "fatal: unable to access 'https://github.com/UserName/project.git/': Failed to connect to github.com port 443: Timed out"

data.title: [html wrong comment syntax while still in script element attributes

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1

```html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>

<body>
  <script src="node_modules/lodash/lodash.min.js"></script>
</body>
</html>
```

When the cursor is at `<scrip^t...`, it is working correctly.
But if the cursor is at `<script^` or in `src="..."`, it is incorrect.

data.title: Keybinding for opening files when navigating sidebar?
data.body:
Thanks Microsoft for this great editor!

This is a feature request based on [issue 28 @vscode-tips-and-tricks](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-tips-and-tricks/issues/28).

One can access the sidebar/explorer with `cmd+shift+e` on mac. But how to open a file from there or say, jump into that file?
`ctrl+enter` only opens it to the side.
just `enter` is used to rename the file…

I haven’t seen any keybinding reference in the keybindings.json.
@waderyan answered that this is not possible yet.

So, please implement it.
To use `space` would be a good idea (currently space only open/collapse folders)

Thank you.

data.title: Allow Setting Syntax With Command Palette
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Setting syntax of a newly created file requires clicking in the bottom right hand corner and selecting from the list of available syntax types. 

In sublime text, the user is able to do this very quickly by `Command Palette` > `Set Syntax: X` and the syntax tools and formatting then are available. This requires no mouse interaction. 

Request: Enable command palette to set syntax quickly based on partial match (ie, set sql should fuzzy match to set syntax: Sql > set power  should fuzzy match to set syntax: Powershell)

data.title: Jumpy cursor with trim trailing whitespace and autosave
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

I think this is a regression.

workspace settings:
```
    "files.autoSave": "afterDelay",
    "files.trimTrailingWhitespace": true,
    "editor.renderWhitespace": "all"
```

* open file `A.ts` side-by-side with itself
* reload workbench
* focus on the right hand side and type two spaces => cursor doesn't jump
* focus on the left hand side and type two spaces on a different line => cursor doesn't jump
* focus on the right hand side and type two spaces => **cursor jumps**
* Note: sometimes reproduces right away
![jumpy](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5047891/21858343/05e51c6e-d829-11e6-99ca-54aab70176d1.gif)

Please let me know if you think this is something on my side, but I think this was implemented initially to work in these cases.

data.title: cannot create multiple folders in the root folder using the New Folder action in the UI
data.body:

|---|---|---|

Steps to Reproduce:

1. from a command prompt, create a newfolder
2. at the command prompt, cd into the newfolder
3. at the command prompt, start VSCode in the newfolder
4. in VSCode, select "Explorer" on the left side menu
5. in VSCode, use the "New Folder" command to create a subfolder1 - notice the subfolder1 being created
6. try creating another subfolder2 at the same level as subfolder1 - notice subfolder2 being created in subfolder1; there is no way I can see to create subfolder2 at the same level as subfolder1
![untitled](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4247685/21857931/393dbd8e-d7f5-11e6-827f-298b5c12b3d0.png)

data.title: HTML and CSS servers should have meaningful default settings
data.body:
At the moment vscode after CSS/HTML language server initialization is sending `didChangeConfiguration` notification to set correct settings. Its ok in general but if such notification wont be sent then some obvious functionalities wont work e.g. validation. I believe that after start the language server should have set of default settings that will enable most important features (without sending additional request). It will help to consume CSS/HTML language server by other clients.

- Version 1.8.1
- Commit ee428b0eead68bf0fb99ab5fdc4439be227b6281
- Date 2016-12-19T14:41:20.664Z
- Shell 1.4.6
- Renderer 53.0.2785.143
- Node 6.5.0

data.title: Global launch.json option
data.body:
I have this file and can use my every project. I just don't want to copy them all the time. VSCode generates .vscode/launch.json file every time at project root, this is no good for me. Is it possible to have just one static and default launch config file? Or a option to avoid this copying problem?

```
{
    "version": "0.2.0",
    "configurations": [
		{
			"type": "node",
			"request": "launch",
			"name": "Launch Program",
			"program": "${file}",
			"cwd": "${workspaceRoot}",
			"runtimeExecutable": "/usr/local/bin/node"
		}
    ]
}
```
> launch.json

- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.2

data.title: Debug toolbar draggable in the 4 edges of the VS Code screen.
data.body:
Feature Request

The debug toolbar that appear when the a process is running, often (in my opinion) is in the wrong place and cover tabs/refresh buttons/console buttons. 
I'd like to drag this toolbar in a custom edge of the editor like in the bottom.

data.title: internalConsoleOptions should be in settings and not in launch configuration
data.body:
The internalConsoleOptions setting should be in the settings.json and not as part of the launch configurations in launch.json

This would enable different developers to be able to choose for them selves if the debug console should open on session start or not while still allowing the launch configurations to be checked in to the project repo (by checking in the launch.json)

data.title: Test: debug with no launch.json
data.body:
Refs: #285
Complexity: 3

- [x] win @ramya-rao-a 
- [x] mac @kieferrm  
- [x] linux @Tyriar 

We now support debugging with no "launch.json" file. Open VSCode in a no folder workspace and verify:
* You can debug an opened `.js` file and everything works as expected
* You can run an opened `.js` file (debug: start without debugging)
* Once you want to generate the launch.json it will only ask to choose the environment if the currently open file type is not supported by any debugger. That is, if you have a .js file open the launch.json will just get created

Now open VSCode in a workspace that does not have a "launch.json" file and quickly verify the same as for the no folder workspace case.

data.title: Honor 'deemphasize' hint of Source objects in CALL STACK view
data.body:
With https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-debugadapter-node/issues/93 Source objects now support an optional `presentationHint` attribute. A value of `deemphasized` indicates that the source reference should be rendered in an de-emphasized style, e.g. dimmed.
Please adopt this for stackframes in the CALL STACK view.

For details see discussion in https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-chrome-debug-core/issues/150
